title: Chettiars collect RM150,000 in donations during Thaipusam
text:
Sunday, 19 February 2017 Chettiars collect RM150,000 in donations during Thaipusam 
GEORGE TOWN: For the first time, the Nattukotai Chettiar Temple has made public the donations received by its 126-year-old silver chariot during the recent Thaipusam celebration. 
The temple’s managing trustee Dr A. Narayanan said yesterday it had collected donations worth RM152,744.80 from the devotees. 
This comes after Penang Hindu Endowment Board chairman Dr P. Ramasamy said it would announce the total donations it received from the golden chariot procession and the Sri Balathandayuthpani Hilltop Murugan Temple in Jalan Kebun Bunga tomorrow. 
For the first time this year, there were two chariot processions – the silver one by the Chettiars and golden chariot by the board. This year, said Dr Narayanan, the trustee had appointed an independent team to manage all the donations and jewelleries received during the procession. 
“Cash donations of the silver chariot were transferred and held in the custody of a private licensed security firm. We also appointed an audit firm to witness the counting of the donations,” he said. 
Dr Narayanan said costs for the procession, the Thaipusam celebration at the temple in Jalan Kebun Bunga and the distribution of free food and facilities for devotees would come from the trust fund. 
“We have also given donations to several non-governmental bodies as in previous years,” he said, adding that these were made in the presence of Health Minister Datuk Seri Dr S. Subramaniam and Chief Minister Lim Guan Eng on Thaipusam. 
The recipients are SJKT Sungai Bakap’s Parent-Teacher Association (PTA) (RM10,000), Vallalar Helping Hand Association (RM5,000), Penang Shan Children’s Home (RM5,000) and Dhyana Ashram (RM5,000).
